elements.content: 222221112211c,12211c,1312b224,141232a15151212134637844453916416311744126434512† Electronic supplementary information (ESI) available: Synthesis, characterization, and additional structural and magnetic data. See DOI: 10.1039/b714678g‡ Synthesis of 1 and 2: An aqueous solution (4 ml) of H2cpdc (20 mg) was adjusted to pH = 7 by dilute NaOH solution, then solid MCl2·nH2O (24 mg, M = Co, n = 6; 20 mg, M = Mn, n = 4) was added and stirred for 20 min. The mixture was transferred to a Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel and heated to 110 °C for 72 h, and then cooled to room temperature. Light yellow block crystals of 1 (yield: 53%) and red block crystals of 2 (yield: 38%) were obtained. EA: Calc. for C12H18Mn3N4O181: C, 21.48; H, 2.70; N, 8.35. Found: C, 21.90; H, 2.90; N, 8.64%. Calc. for C12H18Co3N4O182: C, 21.10; H, 2.66; N, 8.20. Found: C, 20.45; H, 2.87; N, 7.77%.

‡ Synthesis of 1 and 2: An aqueous solution (4 ml) of H2cpdc (20 mg) was adjusted to pH = 7 by dilute NaOH solution, then solid MCl2⋅nH2O (24 mg, M = Co, n = 6; 20 mg, M = Mn, n = 4) was added and stirred for 20 min. The mixture was transferred to a Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel and heated to 110 °C for 72 h, and then cooled to room temperature. Light yellow block crystals of 1 (yield: 53%) and red block crystals of 2 (yield: 38%) were obtained. EA: Calc. for C12H18Mn3N4O181: C, 21.48; H, 2.70; N, 8.35. Found: C, 21.90; H, 2.90; N, 8.64%. Calc. for C12H18Co3N4O182: C, 21.10; H, 2.66; N, 8.20. Found: C, 20.45; H, 2.87; N, 7.77%.

elements.content: 12NaOH1212§ Crystal data: For 1: C12H18Mn3N4O18, Mr = 671.12, triclinic, P, a = 7.499(4), b = 9.246(5), c = 9.374(5) Å, α = 112.158(2), β = 107.435(4), γ = 100.623(4)°, V = 540.8(5) Å3, Z = 1, Dc = 2.061 g cm–3, µ = 1.826 mm–1, F(000) = 337, GOF = 1.066, a total of 4202 reflections were collected, 2410 of which were unique ( Rint = 0.0170). R1 (wR2) = 0.0282 (0.0905) for 169 parameters and 2410 reflections (I > 2σ(I)). CCDC 661336. For 2: C12H18Co3N4O18, Mr = 683.09, triclinic, P, a = 7.3879(19), b = 9.073(2), c = 9.1324(18) Å, α = 112.463(5), β = 106.946(6), γ = 99.518(5)°, V = 513.9(2) Å3, Z = 1, Dc = 2.207 g cm–3, µ = 2.499 mm–1, F(000) = 343, GOF = 1.042, a total of 3973 reflections were collected, 2312 of which were unique ( Rint = 0.0210). R1 (wR2) = 0.0378 (0.1015) for 169 parameters and 2312 reflections (I > 2σ(I)). CCDC 661337. Data were collected on a Rigaku Saturn70 CCD diffractometer for 1 and Rigaku Mercury CCD diffractometer for 2 equipped with graphite-monochromated Mo-Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) at room temperature. The CrystalClear program was used for the absorption correction. All structures were solved by direct methods and refined on F2 by full-matrix least-squares methods using the SHELX97 program package. For crystallographic data in CIF or other electronic format see DOI: 10.1039/b714678g

metadata.title: A two-step field-induced magnetic transition in spin-canted systems observed only for the Co II coordination polymer
